messages: d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:15): How can we drawn pictures into a listbox ?
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (02:15): use a listview
d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:15): listview..
d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:15): lets take a look
d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:17): using listview we can add
d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:17): [img icon] text [another image icon]
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:18): not with a standard listview, iirc.
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:18): check around for hacks to make it work
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:19): or 3rd party controls, and the listview in .net 2 might support it, i can't remember
d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:19): a listview is like
d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:19): an ArrayLike ListBox
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:19): check out ListViewItem, that would be the place to look for it
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:19): kind of i guess
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:19): it's the list with columns and headers (if desired)
d6fa18fa5990fc88ef96e47fe8795603 (02:19): more like excel look lol
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:20): or icon list, but only one icon, the detail view which provides columns and headers doesn't support images or icons in the items, afaik
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:20): there is probably a freely available control or example on doing it maybe at the codeproject.com
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:23): verify everything i've said, i'm pretty certain in .net 1.1 detail view does not support icons though.
cb7048a62114172da59295f867dd4b22 (02:24): .net 2 is a different story, afaik, the only big addition to listview in .net 2 is groups
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:30): anyone there?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:31): frb-work: is there a way to get a button that has a drop down ?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:31): in WinForms
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:31): no fucking idea
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:31): and I'm in a really bad mood
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:32): frb-work, have u used the gzip stream system.IO class before?
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:32): nope, I use asp.net more than anything else
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:32): and it is PISSING ME OFF
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:32): I've used the gzip stream before.
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:32): I follow the examples I find on google, and all I get is exceptions
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:32): What error are you getting?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:32): Kunnis, I can't get it to work
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:32): Kunnis, I used a file stream
7049adecafa952f177c12843254f99ca (02:32): http://pastebot.nd.edu/675
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:32): System.IO.FileStream
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:33): and I put the gzip stream like that
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:33): and then I tried writing the gzip stream to disk
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:33): to  a .zip file
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:33): gzip != zip
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:33): then what is it?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:34): gzip is the gnu util for zipping
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:34): winzip can open gz, but it's not .zip
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:34): then whats deflatstream?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:34): Kunnis, they both use LZW or whatever
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:34): They are close, but not quite
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:34): I might be better just using a 3rd party libary, which would be much eaiser
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:34): so ms has gzip support ?
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:34): why ?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:34): Kunnis, what is a deflatestream then?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:34): they're both the same algorithm, and both can be read cross platform heh
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:34): gzip is part of nix systems?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:34): no, MS doesn't have gzip support
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:34): runtime, I told you dude... icsharpcode.net
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:35): runtime, go use their component
0ded3c5d7daaf36aa8c2e1d8479a0c5a (02:35): System.IO.Compression etc?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:35): deflate and compact are old MS compression formats.
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:35): Kog, but I want to figure out how to use the component that is already there...
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:35): ya know how install files are like .ex_  that's cause they are compacted.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:35): In the old installers before msi
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:36): runtime, I really don't think .NET can do them
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:36): something along those lines, though I may be wrong.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:36): get the 7zip lib, it supports .zip
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:36): SpikeLite msdn2 gzip
74b022cafa2831666188b297a3c5fca2 (02:36): Kog, GZipStream Class (System.IO.Compression): http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.io.compression.gzipstream.aspx
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:36): I stand corrected
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:37): runtime, if you're going to do gzip, why are you not using the example on the site?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:38): Kog, it doesnt write the stream to disk though
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:38): decompress may be unzip command.
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:39): I'll just use the 3rd party libs...theres no point in wasting time
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:39): runtime, so dump a memorystream to disk or something
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:39): or use a filestream
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:39): gzip is designed to compress a single stream of data, you can't gzip multiple files.  .Zip supports multiple files.
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:39): Kunnis, what about deflatestream, same deal?
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:39): What the heck was I thinking then?
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:40): .tar glues multiple files together, so it's really common to tar a bunch of files together, then .gz them, and you get .tar.gz or .tgz
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:40): I'm betting the MS DeflateSTream is the opposite of gzip
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:40): who cares, why use deflate when you can use a zipstream
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:40): deflate may be faster then gz, if you're time senstive, it may matter.
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:41): I dunno though
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:41): I sincerely doubt there'd be a noticable improvement
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:41): good god... Vista search sucks
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:41): I just want to search my local disk for a filename... where did the hide that option
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:42): I've worked on a project where there was a hard choice between .gz and .bz... bz was SOOO Much slower then gz
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:42): yeah, BZIP is pretty damn slow
6eca7b6342d09b0241ed0ddf988824a4 (02:42): Kog, is tar.gz a good format for compressioN?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (02:42): better compression, but usually not good enough such that you care
8768516d0d5cc75769ca93adefdd94b5 (02:42): and .gz is still pretty slow.
